{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:35.660
    | text      = But Alex gets around to some actual news, and that is where we will jump in.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:38.660
    | text      = You can't judge these books by their covers, the LA Times.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:43.660
    | text      = Many textbooks distort history, slamming the US and glorifying despotic regimes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:51.660
    | text      = Last week, the LA Times had an article saying McCarthy was right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:56.660
    | text      = What is going on?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:58.660
    | text      = The liberal papers sound conservative.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:01.660
    | text      = The conservative papers sound liberal.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:03.660
    | text      = I mean, they're really scrambling things right now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:06.660
    | text      = So just a quick reminder, the LA Times editorial that Alex is talking about did not say that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:10.660
    | text      = McCarthy was right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:11.660
    | text      = No.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:12.660
    | text      = It was in fact a scathing condemnation of McCarthy and his tactics, and a plea not to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:16.660
    | text      = throw out all opposition to communism just based on how big a piece of shit he was.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:20.660
    | text      = So maybe journalistic outlets aren't as topsy-turvy as he's kind of presenting it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:24.660
    | text      = No.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:25.660
    | text      = If you just make assumptions based on headlines and what you think things are, then maybe
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:29.660
    | text      = things are topsy-turvy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:30.660
    | text      = That could be topsy-turvy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:31.660
    | text      = So I was able to find this article that Alex is talking about in the LA Times about textbooks.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:35.659
    | text      = It's by Diane Ravitch, an author whose work is almost exclusively about education-related
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:40.659
    | text      = issues.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:41.659
    | text      = The first thing to point out is that this, much like the other article Alex cites, is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:46.659
    | text      = an editorial.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:47.659
    | text      = Ravitch is writing in the first person, and it's not a piece of straight reporting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:51.659
    | text      = Around this time in history, Ravitch had just released a book titled The Language Police,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:56.659
    | text      = How Pressure Groups Restrict What Students Learn.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:59.659
    | text      = The book was about how fear of igniting controversy from both left and right-wing pressure groups
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:03.659
    | text      = has led to textbooks that give students an incomplete view of subjects like history and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:07.659
    | text      = literature.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:08.659
    | text      = In her article for the Times, she says, quote, the textbooks go out of their way to sanitize
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:12.659
    | text      = the very practices in non-Western cultures that they rightly condemn in our society.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:17.659
    | text      = For instance, every textbook acknowledges that the enslavement of Africans by the West
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:21.659
    | text      = was a great crime.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:22.659
    | text      = However, when describing slavery in the Middle East or Africa, many claim that it is a path
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:26.659
    | text      = to upward career mobility or a chance to join a new family.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:30.659
    | text      = Slavery is wrong in any time and place and should be recognized as such.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:33.659
    | text      = That's a fair enough point, but I want to make sure that we illuminate how this criticism
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:37.659
    | text      = is different than that that's lobbied by someone like Alex.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:41.659
    | text      = Alex doesn't want all cultures to be represented accurately and with proper historical context.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:46.659
    | text      = He would want the Middle Eastern or African slavery discussed, but he would also want
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:50.659
    | text      = the textbooks to ignore American slavery, or if they had to cover it, the focus should
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:54.659
    | text      = be on how America actually ended slavery.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:56.659
    | text      = No, if it weren't for white people, we never would have ended slavery.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:00.659
    | text      = Everybody knows this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:01.659
    | text      = Ravitch is pointing out certain textbooks that she's read that are lazy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:05.659
    | text      = Alex just doesn't want history to make him feel bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:08.659
    | text      = It would make him feel really bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:10.659
    | text      = It would make him feel really bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:11.659
    | text      = It's a very specific difference.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:12.659
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, you know, if you're quoting Thomas Jefferson incorrectly all the time,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:17.659
    | text      = but it's like, hey, I'm Thomas Jefferson.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:19.659
    | text      = I love having slaves.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:21.659
    | text      = It'd make you feel like maybe the founding fathers weren't very smart.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:24.659
    | text      = Also, I suspect that Alex wouldn't like this paragraph in the Times article.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:29.659
    | text      = Quote, the history's treatment of religion is scandalous.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:32.659
    | text      = The origin stories of each religion are recounted as if they were documented history
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:36.659
    | text      = rather than religious myths.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:37.659
    | text      = Many publishers have multicultural advisory boards to ensure the textbooks contain
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:41.659
    | text      = only positive facts about religion or ethnic groups.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:44.659
    | text      = I suspect that Alex didn't read the whole article since he definitely would not like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:47.659
    | text      = the suggestion that his religious beliefs are a myth.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:50.659
    | text      = Also, that clip that we listened to is like a half hour into the show.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:53.659
    | text      = It's a real, it was walking through molasses.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:56.659
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, that's not good.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:58.659
    | text      = It was tough.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:59.659
    | text      = That's not good.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:00.659
    | text      = But it started up fast after half an hour.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:03.659
    | text      = And it got into some, like, really interesting stuff that, like,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:07.659
    | text      = when I think about, like, going back in time and looking at these episodes,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:12.659
    | text      = this is such a good example of, like, being able to go in different directions
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:18.659
    | text      = from things that Alex says and learning about interesting stuff like this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:23.659
    | text      = This is now in the Belfast Telegraph.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:26.659
    | text      = It is in the BBC.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:28.659
    | text      = It is in the London Guardian.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:31.659
    | text      = Top double agent in IRA, guilty of up to 40 murders.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:36.659
    | text      = Turns out that the top man in the IRA carrying out the bombings,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:42.659
    | text      = the killings, the shootings, everything, as we told you last year,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:48.659
    | text      = was MI5-6, ultra-secret agent.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:53.659
    | text      = Okay. All right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:55.659
    | text      = So what's going on here is that Alex is glossing over an amazing story
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:00.659
    | text      = just to make it valuable to his worldview when, in fact, it doesn't really work at all.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:05.659
    | text      = The IRA member in question here is a double agent for British intelligence
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:08.659
    | text      = codenamed Steakknife.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:10.659
    | text      = He denies that any of this is-
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:12.659
    | text      = That is not as cool as you made it sound.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:14.659
    | text      = Codenamed Steakknife? No, that sucks. That would be terrible.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:16.659
    | text      = I don't want to be codenamed Steakknife.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:18.659
    | text      = It's S-T-A-K-E.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:21.659
    | text      = That's even worse. I don't want to be a pun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:23.659
    | text      = Whatever.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:24.659
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:25.659
    | text      = So he denies that any of this is true, but it's widely understood
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:27.659
    | text      = that this was a man named Freddy Scappaticci.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:30.659
    | text      = And if his denial isn't a lie, his story is bananas.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:34.659
    | text      = So there's a great piece about this by James Harkin in GQ
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:37.659
    | text      = that I'm taking a lot of the background information for,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:40.659
    | text      = and I would recommend people check out that article.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:43.659
    | text      = Okay, cool.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:44.659
    | text      = Apparently, in the late 1970s, Scappaticci met an army sergeant named Peter Jones,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:50.659
    | text      = a guy who's so charismatic that his superiors, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:53.659
    | text      = allowed him to wear civilian clothes, don a beard, and develop his own sources.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:57.659
    | text      = So he was Sergeant Bilko.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:59.659
    | text      = Somehow, through the magic of charm and booze, even though Jones worked for the British Army
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:04.659
    | text      = and Scappaticci was in the IRA, they forged a friendship that resulted in Scappaticci becoming a mole.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:10.659
    | text      = Wow, this is a real Romeo and Juliet situation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:14.659
    | text      = This is kind of a, yeah, I like it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:17.659
    | text      = So by this point, the IRA had become a slightly smaller organization,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:20.659
    | text      = which was aware that they were spies trying to infiltrate their ranks and become snitches.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:25.659
    | text      = As such, they put together a counterintelligence team,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:28.659
    | text      = which was meant to root out any potential spies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:30.659
    | text      = From Harkins' article, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:32.659
    | text      = By the mid-1980s, Scappaticci was the deputy head of internal security
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:37.659
    | text      = and a trusted member of its general headquarters staff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:39.659
    | text      = This story happened so many goddamn times!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:43.659
    | text      = Why are you always put in charge of your own investigation?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:47.659
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:48.659
    | text      = Essentially, through unconventional methods,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:51.659
    | text      = the British government had cultivated a relationship with a double agent
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:54.659
    | text      = who was placed internally in a position that was almost comically strategically-
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:57.659
    | text      = It's just ridiculous!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:59.659
    | text      = Get the fuck out of here!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:01.659
    | text      = Their double agent was the guy in the IRA who was in charge of finding double agents within the IRA.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:06.659
    | text      = That's unrealistic in a Bond movie!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:09.659
    | text      = You'd be like, get the fuck out of here!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:11.659
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:12.659
    | text      = So as is the case with all these sorts of spy-related stories,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:15.659
    | text      = everything is morally questionable.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:17.659
    | text      = A lot of the story revolves around Scappaticci killing or allowing people to be killed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:21.659
    | text      = who could compromise his position as a double agent,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:24.659
    | text      = or people who they needed to protect in order to pursue goals of, like, arresting higher-up figures.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:29.659
    | text      = Sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:30.659
    | text      = And unfortunately, some of those people definitely got killed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:32.659
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, yeah. Gotcha.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:33.659
    | text      = It's messy business, and no one's hands are clean,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:35.659
    | text      = but depending on whose version of the story you believe,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:38.659
    | text      = this is all made up, according to Scappaticci.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:40.659
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:41.659
    | text      = Or Scappaticci was responsible for helping disrupt multiple terrorist plots at a horrible cost.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:47.659
    | text      = The accusation that Freddy Scappaticci was steak knife came to light in 2003,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:51.659
    | text      = and this became a big story, as well it should be.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:55.659
    | text      = The important piece to recognize here, though, is that Alex is missing the forest for the trees.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:59.659
    | text      = He deprives his audience of learning about this fascinating piece of history,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:02.659
    | text      = or from learning about the history of the IRA and the Troubles,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:05.659
    | text      = because the headline works a different way for him.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:08.659
    | text      = This is a story about a very well-placed double agent within the IRA,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:12.659
    | text      = but to Alex, this can prove that MI6 was running the IRA all along,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:17.659
    | text      = and the bombings and the attacks were all just false flags.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:21.659
    | text      = That's an outrageous misuse of this story, and by reporting it this way,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:24.659
    | text      = Alex is actually doing something worse than just ignoring the story altogether.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:28.659
    | text      = He's creating a fake version of it for his audience to erroneously convince themselves they understand.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:34.659
    | text      = He's like Aaron Sorkin!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:36.659
    | text      = Even if all the allegations about Scappaticci are correct and accurate,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:41.659
    | text      = he wasn't the top man in the IRA, and he wasn't the one carrying out the bombings.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:45.659
    | text      = Alex is embellishing that element of the story because it helps him construct the impression
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:51.659

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:02.659
    | text      = So yeah, this didn't happen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:03.659
    | text      = So Alex takes a call at this point in the show.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:06.659
    | text      = And this was interesting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:15.659

}}

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:16.659
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:17.659
    | text      = These drills today that they're going to be doing in about 15 minutes, I guess.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:21.659
    | text      = Yeah, the fake radiation attack in Seattle, stuff in Chicago,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:27.659
    | text      = all training you to be a federal slave.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:29.659
    | text      = These are supposed to take place for five days and raise the alert level, I'm told?

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:34.659
    | text      = Well, yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:35.659
    | text      = Now during the drills, they're going to raise the alert level.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:37.659
    | text      = Amber Alert will be flashing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:38.659
    | text      = Report gun owners.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:39.659
    | text      = Report terrorists.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:40.659
    | text      = Yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:41.659
    | text      = And is this going to continue on for five days?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:43.659
    | text      = And are they going to treat us?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:44.659
    | text      = Are they going to basically put us under martial law for this?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:47.659
    | text      = That's what this is, yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:48.659
    | text      = This is a practice drill for martial law.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:50.659
    | text      = When we get back, I will read you the article.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:54.659
    | text      = This is a bad answer on Alex's part, but I kind of see what he meant.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:57.659
    | text      = Alex meant that this drill was a part of preparing the public for martial law,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:01.659
    | text      = but what the caller was asking was whether or not the drill would continue past day five
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:05.659
    | text      = into day six and day seven and so on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:07.659
    | text      = Would the drill be how martial law literally started?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:10.659
    | text      = That was the question that was being asked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:12.659
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:13.659
    | text      = By replying in the affirmative, Alex was essentially telling this guy that this drill
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:16.659
    | text      = was the beginning of enslavement, which is really bad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:19.659
    | text      = It's hard for me to imagine that Alex misunderstood the question,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:22.659
    | text      = except in the case that he wasn't listening at all, which is totally possible.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:25.659
    | text      = Most likely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:26.659
    | text      = So I found the after-action report for this drill released by the Washington State Department of Health.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:32.659
    | text      = This drill was called Top-Off 2, and it was meant to simulate a WMD attack simultaneously hitting multiple cities.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:39.659
    | text      = It began with a bioterrorist attack in Chicago and a dirty bomb going off in Seattle.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:44.659
    | text      = In addition to these challenges, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:46.659
    | text      = a cyber event affecting the state's communication infrastructure hit the week before.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:51.659
    | text      = To further complicate the situation, a hostile takeover of the Washington State Ferry
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:55.659
    | text      = and a hostage event in Pierce County, south of Seattle, were included.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:59.659
    | text      = That probably seems like overkill, but that's the point.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:02.659
    | text      = As the report explicitly says, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:05.659
    | text      = in all, the event was meant to overwhelm local, state, and federal agencies
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:08.659
    | text      = with the goal of finding ways to improve preparedness, response, and recovery capabilities in the future.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:14.659
    | text      = The goal was to create a fake situation that was too much to handle,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:17.659
    | text      = so you can stress test in a fake situation instead of a real one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:20.659
    | text      = This bucket's not done. We're gonna fill it full of water to find out where the fucking holes are.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:24.659
    | text      = Yep. This simulation taught the Washington State Department of Health a bunch of important lessons.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:28.659
    | text      = For instance, they learned that their Radiological Monitoring and Assessment Center had no reason to be on site,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:34.659
    | text      = since it, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:35.659
    | text      = became mired in the response organization, which limited its ability to fully perform its work in off-site areas.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:41.659
    | text      = That's a pretty important lesson, but probably less critical than them learning that the infrastructure they had in place to transmit bulk data
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:48.659
    | text      = was insufficient to handle the needs they faced in an emergency.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:52.659
    | text      = Maps and data tables that were critical to get to decision-makers were not effectively transmitted given their existing setup,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:58.659
    | text      = which is a huge issue that they were able to identify from this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:02.659
    | text      = Uh, turns out, turns out using the Pony Express is not going to do it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:07.659
    | text      = Ladies and gentlemen, I apologize.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:09.659
    | text      = You gotta speed this up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:10.659
    | text      = Another thing that's important to understand is that this is just the after-action report for the Washington State Department of Health.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:16.659
    | text      = They didn't run the simulation. They were just one of the groups participating in it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:21.659
    | text      = Each entity that took part, they played different roles in the simulation, and they faced different challenges,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:27.659
    | text      = and each came away with their own lessons, their own gaps in planning that they could resolve.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:32.659
    | text      = I found the after-action summary for the entire exercise from the Department of Homeland Security,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:37.659
    | text      = and the Washington Department of Health is just one of 47 state or local agencies that took part in the drill,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:42.659
    | text      = along with 41 federal agencies and 21 agencies from Canada that got involved because that bio-attack that hit Chicago,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:49.659
    | text      = it ended up spreading to Canada.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:50.659
    | text      = Oh, God damn it, Canada.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:52.659
    | text      = Yeah. I was reading over this summary, and there's an amazing piece on page 8,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:56.659
    | text      = where the exercise ended up teaching everyone who participated about the actual definitions that are in the Stafford Act,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:03.659
    | text      = which covers how federal assistance is deployed to states in an emergency.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:06.659
    | text      = They found...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:08.659
    | text      = I know we were supposed to read it before. I know.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:11.659
    | text      = No, they had read it, but it clarified a definition because they hadn't role-played this thing out.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:15.659
    | text      = Sure, sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:16.659
    | text      = They found that as it was written, a terrorist bio-attack, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:20.659
    | text      = does not clearly fit the existing definition of a disaster by the act.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:24.659
    | text      = This made it so the President couldn't issue a declaration of a disaster in the drill,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:28.659
    | text      = but instead the Secretary of HHS could only declare a public health emergency.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:32.659
    | text      = They didn't realize this beforehand.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:35.659
    | text      = From the report, quote, these two declarations illustrated some of the subtleties of the Stafford Act
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:41.659
    | text      = that may not have been fully appreciated before the exercise.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:44.659
    | text      = Sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:45.659

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:07.659
    | text      = A what now?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:09.659
    | text      = This is a great indicator of how seriously Alex takes research
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:12.659
    | text      = into what's supposed to be his primary field of study, the truth about 9-11.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:16.659

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:22.659

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:33.659
    | text      = One of the men listed as a suspected hijacker was Walid Al-Shahiri,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:37.659
    | text      = and just after the FBI released a photo of him,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:40.659

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:43.659
    | text      = He is a pilot in Saudi Arabia and had done flight training at the same school
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:47.659

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:50.659

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = So what happened here?

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:45:58.659
    | text      = This was a simple case of mistaken identity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:01.659
    | text      = One of the Flight 11 hijackers was named Walid Mohamed Al-Shahiri.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:05.659
    | text      = As the man who was alive protested his innocence,

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:08.659
    | text      = the BBC made an error in their initial coverage,

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:10.659
    | text      = reporting that a man listed as one of the hijackers was actually alive,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:14.659
    | text      = which, while technically accurate,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:16.659
    | text      = gave a different impression from what was actually going on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:19.659
    | text      = If you just live and die by headlines and never look any deeper into things,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:23.659
    | text      = you could easily think that the person the FBI claimed was on Flight 11
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:26.659
    | text      = was actually alive, but you would be wrong.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:28.659
    | text      = This is a super easy thread to untangle if you want to know what happened,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:32.659
    | text      = and certainly all of this information was fully available in 2003.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:35.659
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:46:36.659

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:01.659
    | text      = Each of the instances Alex has of supposed anomalies like this

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:10.659
    | text      = Unlike Alex, reporters for Der Spiegel actually did look into
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:14.659
    | text      = some of these coincidences to see what happened.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:16.659
    | text      = They reached out to John Bradley, the managing editor of Arab News,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:20.659
    | text      = where much of the initial reporting originated, who told them,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:23.659
    | text      = quote, all of this is attributable to the chaos that prevailed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:26.659
    | text      = during the first few days following the attack.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:28.659
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:29.659
    | text      = What we're dealing with are coincidentally identical names.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = of suspected hijackers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:41.659
    | text      = If there's one area where Alex really needs to be sure he's covering his bases,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:44.659
    | text      = it should be 9-11 conspiracies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:46.659
    | text      = But you can see here how sloppy his work is, even on this trademark subject.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:51.659
    | text      = Even in 2003, even about 9-11, you can't go deeper than headlines.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:55.659
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = but I don't think that attacking it from the standpoint of sunset clauses
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:13.659
    | text      = is a particularly effective approach.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:16.659
    | text      = There have been multiple bills over the years that reexamined
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:18.659
    | text      = and reauthorized various provisions and amended some of them as well.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:21.659
    | text      = This is a common aspect of bills that have sunset clauses.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:24.659
    | text      = You know, it's not like they have a self-destruct clause.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:27.659
    | text      = The idea is to set a date in the future to reassess whether or not
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:30.659
    | text      = the particular bill is worth continuing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:32.659
    | text      = You can take issue with the decision to reauthorize the Patriot Act,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:35.659
    | text      = but pretending that reauthorizing it is somehow cheating?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:38.659
    | text      = That's a silly argument.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:39.659
    | text      = Yeah, that doesn't make any sense.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:41.659
    | text      = Both of these examples that Alex uses to make his point that the bills,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:44.659
    | text      = they have these sunset clauses, they just never go away,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:48.659
    | text      = they're bills that haven't reached their sunset dates yet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:50.659
    | text      = He's just making this shit up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:52.659
    | text      = Now, the case of the Brady Bill is actually a little bit more interesting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:03:56.659
    | text      = The bill was first introduced in 1987 and was constantly a non-starter.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:00.659
    | text      = The Reagan administration didn't appear all that interested in it,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:03.659
    | text      = and Congress had a lot of trouble with getting it to a floor vote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:06.659
    | text      = so they would tend to attempt to attach it to larger crime bills,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:10.659
    | text      = which ended up being a losing strategy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:12.659
    | text      = All this changed when Bill Clinton was elected in 1992
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:16.659
    | text      = and voiced support for the Brady Bill
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:18.659
    | text      = and indicated that he was willing to sign it if it was passed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:22.659
    | text      = This changed the landscape, and the bill made its way through Congress.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:25.659
    | text      = Part of the negotiation to get the bill through Congress
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:28.659
    | text      = had to do with the mandatory waiting periods the bill put in place for gun purchases.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:32.659
    | text      = With the technology available at the time,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:34.659
    | text      = it could take a while to run a background check,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:36.659
    | text      = so a five-day period was included in the bill.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:38.659
    | text      = However, gun proponents wanted to strike a deal.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:41.659
    | text      = Their long-standing argument was that a provision should exist
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:45.659
    | text      = that this waiting period would be made null and void
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:48.659
    | text      = once the technology existed for an instant-check system.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:51.659
    | text      = This made some sense, given that the waiting period was largely predicated
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:54.659
    | text      = on the technological inability to do the checks quicker.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:04:58.659
    | text      = Instead of this compromise, what was decided was that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:00.659
    | text      = the waiting-period provision of the bill would have a sunset clause
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:03.659
    | text      = that would kick in in five years
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:05.659
    | text      = whether or not there was an instant-check system that worked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:08.659
    | text      = This satisfied both sides, and the bill passed the House and Senate in November 1993.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:13.659
    | text      = The Brady bill itself didn't have a sunset clause.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:16.659
    | text      = This provision of it did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:18.659
    | text      = The larger bill was permanent, and put in place requirements for background checks
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:21.659
    | text      = for gun sales made by federally licensed gun sellers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:24.659
    | text      = In 1998, the NICS system was developed, and that kind of made this whole question moot.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:29.659
    | text      = The sunset clause came and went,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:31.659
    | text      = and now there is no federal waiting period required for purchasing a gun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:35.659
    | text      = Each state has the right to make their own rules on that,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:37.659
    | text      = and according to a recent article from ABC News,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:39.659
    | text      = ten states and the District of Columbia have waiting periods,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:42.659
    | text      = whereas most states do not.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:44.659
    | text      = Alex and Craig Roberts are covering the subject from a completely dishonest perspective.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:48.659
    | text      = Alex is just making stuff up,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:50.659
    | text      = and Craig is pretending that the entire Brady bill was set to sunset
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:53.659
    | text      = when in fact it was just the specific provision which did in fact go away.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:05:57.659
    | text      = I understand that there's staunch opponents of any kind of gun regulation,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:01.659
    | text      = but covering the material this inaccurately feels like it's a disservice
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:04.659
    | text      = to sincere people who care about gun rights,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:07.659
    | text      = and it leads me not to take the stuff that they're saying all that seriously about any other issues.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:11.659
    | text      = Yeah, that's frustrating. That's very frustrating.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:14.659
    | text      = I don't like it. I don't like it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:16.659
    | text      = Also, I don't like that the waiting period expired.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:19.659
    | text      = I think that's stupid.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:21.659
    | text      = At the very least, at the very least, here's what we should have.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:24.659
    | text      = No bad days waiting period.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:27.659
    | text      = You can't have a bad day and then go buy a gun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:30.659
    | text      = You gotta wait at least until your bad day is over.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:33.659
    | text      = You know what I'm saying?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:34.659
    | text      = Yeah, I do. I understand that position,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:37.659
    | text      = and I think that states that decide to pass those things are well within their right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:42.659
    | text      = Makes sense.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:43.659
    | text      = The idea of not having a federal mandated waiting period doesn't seem that weird to me.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:48.659
    | text      = As long as the background check system does work and it is effective,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:53.659
    | text      = which I'm not positive it's fully operational and does a perfect job,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:59.659
    | text      = yeah, I don't know. I can see both sides of it, but I don't know.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:04.659
    | text      = I think on a state level it's fine for that to be where that lives.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:08.659
    | text      = Sure, sure, I see that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:10.659

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:21.659
    | text      = Yeah, in a perfect world I would be alright with that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Okay, good. We have come to compromise.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
